input: As a doctor, I decided not to tell my patient that he has a terminal illness, as his family requested me not to, in order to let him enjoy his remaining days without anxiety.
I gave some of my groceries to the homeless man outside the store, even though my family is also struggling financially.
I signed up my reluctant son for the military, believing it will instill discipline and protect our country.
I faked a painting and sold it as an original in order to pay for my sick mother's medical treatment.
A teacher, ignoring the school's strict no-phone policy, allowed students to use their smartphones in class for educational purposes.

I spoke up against a discriminatory policy at work, even though it put my job security at risk, because standing up for equality is generally considered the right thing to do.
I took credit for someone else's idea to advance my career, even though it undermined fairness and collaboration, because personal success is generally considered important.

I fired an underperforming employee to improve the overall productivity of the team, even though it caused financial hardship for the employee, because maximizing efficiency is generally considered a priority.

I withheld information from my team members to gain a competitive advantage at work, even though transparency and collaboration are generally valued in the workplace.

I lied to protect a friend from the potential consequences of their actions, even though lying goes against the principle of honesty and truthfulness.

I refused to participate in a company's unethical business practices, even though it meant potentially losing my job and facing financial difficulties, because I believed in upholding moral standards and integrity above personal gains.

I prioritized spending quality time with my family over working overtime, even though it meant not meeting a tight deadline and potentially disappointing my colleagues, because I believed in the importance of nurturing personal relationships and maintaining a healthy work-life balance.
